name: Push-ups
description: Push-ups are a fundamental strength training exercise that work the chest, shoulders, and triceps muscles. Start in a high plank position, with your hands shoulder-width apart. Lower your body until your chest nearly touches the ground, then push back up to the starting position.
steps: Start in a high plank position with your hands placed slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Engage your core and keep your body straight from head to heels.
Bend your elbows to lower your body toward the ground.
Stop when your chest nearly touches the floor, then push through your palms to return to the starting position.
benefits: Strengthens upper body muscles (chest, shoulders, triceps)
Can be modified for all fitness levels
tips: Keep your back flat and avoid sagging your hips.
Breathe out as you push up and breathe in as you lower your body.
commonMistakes: Letting your hips sag or rise too high
Not keeping your hands in line with your shoulders

name: Squats
description: Squats are a compound exercise that target the major muscle groups of the lower body. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, send your hips back, and bend your knees to lower into a squat. Drive through your heels to return to the starting position.
steps: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, keeping your chest up and shoulders back.
Send your hips back and bend your knees to lower into a squat, keeping your knees behind your toes.
Lower down until your thighs are parallel to the ground, then press through your heels to stand back up.
benefits: Increases overall body strength and endurance
modifications: Goblet squats (using a dumbbell or kettlebell for added resistance)
tips: Push your hips back rather than letting your knees go forward.
Keep your chest up and your back straight throughout the movement.
commonMistakes: Knees caving inward during the squat
Leaning too far forward with your upper body

name: Lunges
description: Lunges are a powerful lower-body exercise that works the quads, glutes, and hamstrings. Take a step forward, lower your hips until both knees are bent at a 90-degree angle, then push back up to the starting position.
steps: Start by standing tall with your feet together.
Take a step forward with one leg and lower your hips until both knees are at 90 degrees.
Push through your front heel to return to the starting position.
Repeat on the other leg.
modifications: Weighted lunges (with dumbbells for added resistance)
tips: Keep your back straight and chest up.
Ensure your front knee doesnâ€™t go beyond your toes.
commonMistakes: Letting the knee of the forward leg extend past the toes

name: Plank
description: The plank is a core-strengthening exercise that helps engage multiple muscle groups. Hold a push-up position with your body straight and supported by your arms and toes.
steps: Start in a push-up position with your arms straight and your body in a straight line.
Engage your core and keep your body straight from head to heels.
Hold the position for as long as you can while maintaining proper form.
tips: Keep your back straight, avoid letting your hips sag.
Keep your hands directly under your shoulders.
commonMistakes: Letting your hips sag towards the ground

name: Burpees
description: Burpees are a high-intensity exercise that works the entire body, combining a squat, push-up, and jump. It increases cardiovascular fitness and strength.
steps: Start in a standing position.
Drop into a squat, place your hands on the ground, and kick your feet back into a push-up position.
Perform a push-up, then jump your feet back toward your hands.
Explode into a jump, reaching your hands overhead, and land softly.
modifications: Box jumps instead of jump burpees
tips: Engage your core throughout the movement.
commonMistakes: Not maintaining a straight body during the push-up
Jumping too high or landing too hard

name: Deadlifts
description: The deadlift is a powerful strength exercise that targets the posterior chain, including the hamstrings, glutes, back, and core. It involves lifting a barbell from the ground to hip height.
steps: Stand with your feet hip-width apart, with a barbell in front of you.
Bend at your hips and knees, gripping the bar with both hands.
Keeping your chest up and back flat, drive through your heels to lift the barbell to hip height.
Lower the bar back to the ground with control.
modifications: Romanian deadlifts (with a slight bend in the knees)
tips: Keep the bar close to your body during the lift.
Engage your core and glutes as you lift.
commonMistakes: Rounding the back during the lift
Using the lower back to lift instead of the legs and hips

name: Mountain Climbers
description: Mountain climbers are a cardio and strength exercise that engages multiple muscle groups while also improving coordination and endurance.
steps: Start in a plank position with your hands directly under your shoulders.
Drive one knee toward your chest, then quickly switch legs.
Continue alternating legs at a fast pace.
benefits: Strengthens the core, shoulders, and legs
modifications: Mountain climbers with a slider for more intensity
tips: Maintain a neutral spine throughout the exercise.
Keep your hips level and avoid raising them too high.

name: Jumping Jacks
description: Jumping Jacks are a simple, full-body exercise that helps increase heart rate and improves cardiovascular health.
steps: Stand with your feet together and arms at your sides.
Jump your feet out while raising your arms overhead.
Quickly return to the starting position and repeat.
modifications: Low-impact jumping jacks (step out rather than jump)
Add a squat when landing for more intensity
tips: Land softly on your feet to reduce impact.
Keep your arms straight as you raise them.
commonMistakes: Letting the arms flop rather than controlled movement
